versions.label: Prefiled
versions.raw_html:
The following has special meaning:
green underline denotes added text
red struck out text denotes deleted text
2024 VA H 1642
Author: Hayes
Version: Prefiled
Version Date: 01/03/2025

HOUSE BILL NO. 1642

Offered January 8, 2025

Prefiled January 3, 2025

A BILL to amend the Code of Virginia by adding in Title 19.2 a chapter numbered 1.3, consisting of sections numbered 19.2-11.14 and 19.2-11.15, relating to criminal justice risk assessments; human oversight.

Patron Hayes

Committee Referral Pending

Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Virginia:

1. That the Code of Virginia is amended by adding in Title 19.2 a chapter numbered 1.3, consisting of sections numbered 19.2-11.14 and 19.2-11.15, as follows:

CHAPTER 1.3.

CRIMINAL JUSTICE RISK ASSESSMENTS.

§ 19.2-11.14. Definitions.

As used in this chapter, unless the context requires a different meaning:

"Artificial intelligence-based tools" means software systems or algorithms, including machine learning models, predictive analytics, and decision support systems, that analyze data and generate recommendations or predictions used to inform criminal justice decisions.

"Human oversight" means the process by which a qualified human decision maker reviews and approves the outputs or recommendations of an artificial intelligence-based tool prior to its use in making or informing a final decision.

§ 19.2-11.15. Criminal justice risk assessments; human oversight.

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the recommendations or predictions provided by any artificial intelligence-based tool utilized for criminal justice purposes, including recommendations or predictions related to pretrial release, sentencing, probation, or parole, shall be reviewed and approved by a qualified human decision maker prior to using any such recommendations or predictions in making or informing a final decision. No decision related to pretrial release, sentencing, probation, or parole may rely solely on the recommendation of an artificial intelligence-based tool without documented human oversight. Documentation of such human oversight shall include the artificial intelligence-generated recommendation or prediction and the rationale for its acceptance, modification, or rejection by the qualified human decision maker.


Copyright © 2025 State Net

follows:**

_CHAPTER 1.3._

_CRIMINAL JUSTICE RISK ASSESSMENTS._

**_ยง 19.2-11.14. Definitions._ **

_As used in this chapter, unless the context requires a different meaning:_

_" Artificial intelligence-based tools" means software systems or algorithms,
including machine learning models, predictive analytics, and decision support
systems, that analyze data and generate recommendations or predictions used to
inform criminal justice decisions._

_" Human oversight" means the process by which a qualified human decision
maker reviews and approves the outputs or recommendations of an artificial
intelligence-based tool prior to its use in making or informing a final
decision._

**_ยง 19.2-11.15. Criminal justice risk assessments; human oversight._ **

_Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the recommendations or
predictions provided by any artificial intelligence-based tool utilized for
criminal justice purposes, including recommendations or predictions related to
pretrial release, sentencing, probation, or parole, shall be reviewed and
approved by a qualified human decision maker prior to using any such
recommendations or predictions in making or informing a final decision. No
decision related to pretrial release, sentencing, probation, or parole may

without documented human oversight. Documentation of such human oversight
shall include the artificial intelligence-generated recommendation or
prediction and the rationale for its acceptance, modification, or rejection by

versions.label: Recommended as Substituted from Committee
versions.raw_html:
The following has special meaning:
green underline denotes added text
red struck out text denotes deleted text
2024 VA H 1642
Author: Hayes
Version: Recommended as Substituted from Committee
Version Date: 01/17/2025

HOUSE BILL NO. 1642

AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE

(Proposed by the House Committee for Courts of Justice

on January 17, 2025)

(Patron Prior to Substitute--Delegate Hayes)

A BILL to amend the Code of Virginia by adding in Title 19.2 a chapter numbered 1.3, consisting of a section numbered 19.2-11.14, relating to use of artificial intelligence-based tool for criminal justice purpose.

Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Virginia:

1. That the Code of Virginia is amended by adding in Title 19.2 a chapter numbered 1.3, consisting of a section numbered 19.2-11.14, as follows:

CHAPTER 1.3.

ARTIFICIAL INTELLENCE-BASED TOOLS FOR CRIMINAL JUSTICE PURPOSES.

§ 19.2-11.14. Use of artificial intelligence-based tool for criminal justice purpose.

A. As used in this section:

"Artificial intelligence-based tool" means any software systems or algorithms, including machine learning models, predictive analytics, and decision support systems, that analyze data and generate recommendations or predictions used to inform criminal justice decisions.

"Criminal justice purpose" means any activity related to pretrial detention or release, prosecution, adjudication, probation, parole, correctional supervision, or rehabilitation of criminal offenders.

B. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the recommendations or predictions provided by any artificial intelligence-based tool utilized for any criminal justice purpose shall not be the sole basis for any decision related to such criminal justice purpose. However, the results of any artificial intelligence-based tool may be used in informing a final decision, provided that any such final decision is made by a human.


Copyright © 2025 State Net

_A. As used in this section:_

_" Criminal justice purpose" means any activity related to pretrial detention

_B. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the recommendations or

artificial intelligence-based tool may be used in informing a final decision,

versions.raw_html:
The following has special meaning:
green underline denotes added text
red struck out text denotes deleted text
2024 VA H 1642
Author: Hayes
Version: Recommended as Substituted from Committee
Version Date: 02/12/2025

HOUSE BILL NO. 1642

AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE

(Proposed by the Senate Committee for Courts of Justice

on February 12, 2025)

(Patron Prior to Substitute Delegate Hayes)

A BILL to amend the Code of Virginia by adding in Title 19.2 a chapter numbered 1.3, consisting of a section numbered 19.2-11.14, relating to use of artificial intelligence-based tool.

Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Virginia:

1. That the Code of Virginia is amended by adding in Title 19.2 a chapter numbered 1.3, consisting of a section numbered 19.2-11.14, as follows:

CHAPTER 1.3.

ARTIFICIAL INTELLENCE-BASED TOOLS.

§ 19.2-11.14. Use of artificial intelligence-based tool.

A. As used in this section, "artificial intelligence-based tool" means any machine-based system or algorithm, including machine learning models, predictive analytics, and decision support systems, that analyze data and generate recommendations or predictions.

B. All decisions related to the pre-trial detention or release, prosecution, adjudication, sentencing, probation, parole, correctional supervision, or rehabilitation of criminal offenders shall be made by the judicial officer or other person charged with making such decision. No such decision shall be made solely on the basis of a recommendation or prediction of an artificial intelligence-based tool. The use of any such tool, recommendation, or prediction shall be subject to any challenge or objection permitted by law.


Copyright © 2025 State Net
